website_summaries.verdict: Excellent range for connecting from room to room, this is a great receiver for home audio systems.
pros: Bridges easily between home automation devices like Echo and sound systems
cons: Some stuttering and dropout at longer range or behind walls
No battery backup (though that’s not a big deal for home stereo use)
Slight latency even at close range

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only one week
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ for the first week. After that, would connect but would not play music. I could hear scratching like a bad cable, so swapped out the cables with same result. Contacted TP-Link and after much back and forth, was told had to register the product for them to replace as defective. So I tried to register only to be told that it was not a valid serial number. Contacted TP-Link support again and they wanted me to retry registering. By that time, almost a month had gone by emailing with TP-Link so just returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: This little gadget is the best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is the best thing since sliced bread, and it is just what I needed to play streaming music over my home stereo system via Bluetooth. It is simple to hook up and the sound is very good too. I have an Amazon Echo Dot connected which provides the streaming music services, and I have also paired my smartphone so I can stream radio from iHeart radio, Sirius XM, Pandora and Spotify. If you are looking for a Bluetooth device to upgrade your home stereo system, this thing is just the ticket. It only costs $20.00 and has more than met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: dakotamoviefan

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for cars
customer_reviews.text: This is ideal for a car set up where the original stereo has auxiliary input. Since it doesn't have a battery you can connect it to a USB adapter from the car so that it turns on and off with the car. In my 2002 Lexus IS300 I used an adapter cable that comes with a USB port, so it was as simple as plugging the two cables of the adapter into the Bluetooth receiver, pair the device and now my phone connects automatically when I start the car. And I can keep everything hidden inside of the dashboard. This is the adapter for the IS300:
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Want to like it but..
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this product, and I did for the first 2 days. Great sound, added bluetooth to my stereo just what I needed. Unfortunately after 2 days I went to power it on & it wouldn't turn on, I had to unplug it wait 30sec & replug it & it worked. Thought it was a fluke, but then it happened again after about 10 power cycles. Ever since then it's been doing it more & more often to where now it does it every 3rd time I turn it on. Maybe I received a bad unit with all the good ratings on this item? Anyways packing it back up & returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Brn2dream

customer_reviews.title: True plug & play - a great thing
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This little device is simple, plug in and play, and in seconds it took my 1986 combo stereo (a Sanyo turntable, AM/FM tuner, with dual cassette and auxiliary in) screaming into this century. Impressive, and allows for at least two Bluetooth devices to be paired at once (I have all iOS devices and as stated in the enclosed manual, there is some delay in switching from one to the other, but it's a matter of maybe 5 or so seconds). I love this! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: MusicLover1973

customer_reviews.title: Blue Tooth Device with a Great Range
customer_reviews.text: Based on the recommendation of a friend, I purchased and installed this device on a Sherwood home theater receiver that did not have Blue Tooth or Wi-Fi. The TP Link was easy to install and set-up. Blue tooth easily searched and found this device. The straight forwardness and simplicity makes it easy to set up and use. The other thing that was pleasing was the great range that the TP Link has. I can roam far from this device (which is upstairs) without jeopardizing the signal--even outside. Highly recommended for an older receiver. I was thankful for the recommendation as there are many of these devices to choose from and this made the choice simple.
customer_reviews.author: Trauts

customer_reviews.title: Car too old to include Bluetooth, iPhone X too new to include headphone jack... enter THIS product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2009 Honda Pilot and it has no Bluetooth connection. It does have a 3.5 AUX port in the center console as well as power. I installed the TP-LINK in the console and connected it to my phone and voila... I have music! This product works perfect. I never have to touch it or reconnect it. It powers on with the car and powers off when I turn the car off. It connects immediately when I turn the car on. The sound is fantastic. The setup was ridiculously easy. This product did EXACTLY what I was hoping it would do. It works perfectly. HIGHLY recommended in this situation!
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Leffel

customer_reviews.title: Converted my 2012 Audi to bluetooth music
customer_reviews.text: I combined this with a 3.5mm adapter for my 2012 Audi Q5 to create a great systems for my car. My iPhone X connects immediately each time my car starts now, giving me great sounding wireless music in my car. I'm a professional musician and very fussy about my music equipment and sound systems - this bluetooth wireless receiver sounds pretty much perfect to my ears. Highly recommended for slightly older cars without native bluetooth high quality music already available.
customer_reviews.author: jasond

customer_reviews.title: It can't drive the line inputs of my receiver. Poor audio quality.
customer_reviews.text: After testing this for a week I am returning it for refund. It can't drive the line inputs of my receiver enough to get good volume without overdriving the amplifier gain to +10dB. For comparison, I have a Chromecast Audio and the amplifier gain needs only -20dB for good output volume. The sound quality at +10dB is distorted and not enjoyable. You can buy a Belkin Bluetooth receiver instead and you get a digital optical and coaxial output for best audio quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aldrin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy way to get Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: We now have bluetooth in our 06 Honda Pilot EXL with the stock radio with nav. I purchased a $30 GTA car kit adapter knock off that plugged right into the radio. I then plugged the TP link Bluetooth adapter into the jack and got the power thru my switched 12v power outlet. Once linked to my iPhone it automatically connects each time I start the Pilot. I can stream everything effortlessly from my phone and get excellent sound quality. Plus I still have full functionality of the stock radio,gps and steering wheel controls.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Ball Jr

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into a gizmo that connects to the factory stereo of a 2006 Honda Odyssey, EX-L (I left a review for that, too, if you care to look it up). This item is powered through USB, which was necessary. It’s zip tied up under my dashboard with no problems. I wish the Bluetooth would reach out and find my phone instead of having to connect through the Bluetooth settings every time. But for the price I am pleased. Got this “open box” from the amazon warehouse with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Bow Tie Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BT adapter for a very affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: This BT adapter doesn't have a built-in rechargeable battery like some others but that's exactly what I needed as I have mine powered thru my amplifier's switched power socket - So it turns on only when my amp is turned on, and turns off when the amp is turned off, thus immediately unpairing from my source (either a tablet, or phone). BT connection set-up was swift and flawless. There's no lag either in connectivity or sound transmission. I haven't tried working the NFC feature so cannot comment on that, but this is an excellent product overall otherwise :)
customer_reviews.author: Jazzman4U

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxious volume adjust beep and not password protected
customer_reviews.text: Two main issues: 1 - if you live in a city, somebody will pair with it 2 - each time you adjust the volume there is an obnoxious beep sound. I have not found it to automatically connect and have to connect to it whenever I come back into range. There are so many of these out on the market now I’ll be looking for one that has a pairing button or passcode and doesn’t kill the mood when I adjust the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Mellan

customer_reviews.title: Fast paring to Android phones and Windows 10 PC. ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast paring to Android phones and Windows 10 PC. Very reasonable price. High quality signal no discernable noise when connected to an HIFI system. I do have dedicate DAC for "critical listening sessions" but the convenience of this setup is making the DAC use a rare occurrence. In my, almost line-of-sight environment, connection did start to degrade when distance exceeded 26 feet (PC with a 4.0 Bluetooth Low Energy USB Adapter). No problem at 24 feet. Mileage may vary... My son uses one in the car. Easier than plugging the AUX cable, but it's not a replacement for car Bluetooth hand free call adapter (no MIC).
customer_reviews.author: SilverLining

customer_reviews.title: Great way to use Alexa with an older AV receiver.
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link connects my Echo to my old stereo receiver using the CD connection. The power cable goes to the back of the receiver, so when I turn on the receiver it automatically is available via TP-Link's bluetooth to the Echo and Alexa (unless I've changed the source since last using it). I can't turn receiver on/off or manage other features; these all have to be done via the receiver's own remote. But the music coming from the Echo is great quality. And it's a lot better than spending $350-$650 for a new Alexa-compatible receiver!
customer_reviews.author: Alldog49

customer_reviews.title: Has the features I needed
customer_reviews.text: Range is great if you have it out in the open. I put this inside of my masonry BBQ and the range was cut down to about 30 feet. Still works but I will relocate for use all around the back yard. The reason I chose this unit was the connection qualities. Yo do not have to crawl under the BBQ or behind your stereo cabinet to press a button like the other units I have purchased, connection is automatic each time I turn on the stereo (via remote control) so music in my back yard is all remote. Quality of music is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great no issues with audio
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my mi box that's connected to my ceiling mounted projector. It works great so far I have it plugged into a spare phone charger and haven't had any problems. This little device saved me alot of trouble and money I was going to buy a new soundbar for my setup. I already have nice speakers there just not bluetooth and I didn't want to run a long auxiliary cord. So I'm more than satisfied with this and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fields

customer_reviews.title: Just Works
customer_reviews.text: These types of reviews are easy to write. Does it connect easily? Yes. Does it sound good? Yes. What happens if you try to connect a different device? Connects fine. How's the range? I can use it with my phone in the kitchen and it being on the other side of a solid wall and probably 20 feet away. If I go down the hall and into the bedroom, it starts to stutter. Pretty standard Bluetooth range.
customer_reviews.author: lkfsdg

customer_reviews.title: Fairly disappointed.  Works but lower quality than china brands?
customer_reviews.text: I have an off brand one that literally in the most has a female with the strongest asian accent I've ever heard say " Da bluetoo devY is connected-uh sucessFOE-lay" its sound quality, functionality and features make this TP link sound like my FLAC media sound like it was coming from a cassette tape. Going to try with a different audio cable other than provided but as received, I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ward

customer_reviews.title: Alexa and I like this receiver
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A little challenging to get setup correctly (2 accounts, two speaker systems, two people using Alexa, one Alexa. However, once we got connected, it's clear that Alexa likes this receiver. While she won't say so directly (if she endorses a product she will get fired), her voice is brighter, she just plain sounds happier. She speaks more clearly too, which is very kind of her. I think she's a lot happier than she was when she had to use my cheap speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this device for a few weeks now and it works great! Audio quality could be a bit better but the overall convince of not having to wire in my phone directly into my car is great. I have had not issues connecting to the device and the NFC tag works great. Over all if you are looking for an inexpensive way to add Bluetooth audio to your car, this is a great option for vehicles that have a hidden auxiliary input in a glovebox or center console. If you are looking dlfor something for the home you would be better served buy a Chromecast audio or some other wifi enabled airplay device.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Smothering my home in audio waves of bluetooth gravy
customer_reviews.text: Blew away other bluetooth receiver devices I've tried. It's an attractive, shiny black case design that I have no problem leaving on display upon my media centre. Audio quality is quite good for bluetooth. Connection strength is superb. I'm able to connect and stream from my devices through multiple walls, ceilings, floors, and across the house - even outside. I half expect someone walking down my street to find the device and start casting to my audio setup. Did not expect that from bluetooth. Plan to buy at least one more for another audio device, maybe two to have a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Trevor

customer_reviews.title: It works and is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Setting this up was a breeze and it works just fine in my application. The USB cable is very short so I used one I already had and the 2.5 mm to RCA adapter is a little cheesy so I used one that I already had, though I have no doubt that the one supplied would work fine. The receiver is very small, great if you want to "make it disappear" in your equipment rack or on your shelf. If you want to provide Bluetooth connectivity to some older stereo hardware this will do the trick and it is relatively inexpensive for how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Brown

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. It doesn't have a battery
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It doesn't have a battery, it doesn't do phone, and it supports two simultaneously paired devices. I have this plugged into my aux in on a switched power lighter plug. My car has a bluetooth phone, but not bluetooth audio, but my wife often wants to listen to her music when we're driving together. This keeps everything simple. No pairing button - it pairs with my phone as soon as it gets power. I never have to unpair my phone, my wife can pair when she wants, and my music stops when I turn off the car because there's no battery in it. Sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K. Price

customer_reviews.title: Only routes media audio not telephone audio
customer_reviews.text: While only routing media audio (music) from the phone to the stereo may be desirable for most people, those of us with no in-car phone bluetooth would like to have ALL audio run to the stereo including phone calls. There is no option with this device to do that. There may be APPS in the store to help with that but it will be an additional cost and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tad C. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Just 1 thing missing
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I don't have an audio connection for Bluetooth in my vehicle. I absolutely love it other than the fact that it has to be plugged in during use. Would be even better if it were rechargeable. Overall, a really great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Ro

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this in a 2007 Honda CR-V EX, where the 3.5mm AUX input is in the center between the front seats. I can pretty much just hide the unit completely and never have to even look at it. It picks up my Galaxy S9+ every time, reliably, so it's really just out of sight, out of mind. Sound quality is excellent, no issues at all. Do realize that you have to power this thing somehow. It comes with a charging cable, which is nice, but not a power adapter to your car.
customer_reviews.author: hansmuff

customer_reviews.title: Neat device!  Can't rename.
customer_reviews.text: It works well so long as you're relatively close. (My patio stereo connection breaks if I walk very far away, or if there's a concrete pillar between myself and the TP-Link.) My only real gripe is not being able to re-name it. It works so well, I bought another, but I just have to remember which one is which in the Bluetooth list on my phone, because I can't go into the system and re-name them for easy identification.
customer_reviews.author: David McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: This NFC unit works great. I hooked it up to my sony receiver, waved my xperia over it and let my play list off spotify stream. No breaks, jumps, bumps, or dumps. This is a handy gadget to have. The NFC allows 8 different donor communicators to be memorized. For the future, don't buy anything that isn't Near Field Communications enabled. I agree with one reviewer that the cord for the recharger is a bit too short to go from the wall socket to the receiving unit (stereo in my case). Otherwise I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Willywolf

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth adapter works very well
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth adapter works very well. I have used in a car that doesnt have Bluetooth capability built in. Since it does not turn off automatically, i have to remember to unplug it after i park overnight or for long periods. My cell phone connects to it quickly and reliably so far. Sound quality is as expected for using Bluetooth and an analog input to the radio.
customer_reviews.author: ParaboTECH

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had a blue tooth converter in the past, and it worked perfectly. I bought this for an older home stereo. Hookup was straightforward. I attached the 2 RCA plugs to the "phono." or turntable type inputs. When the music from my phone is played, just one of the speakers works, and there is significant static. I thought that one of the channels or speakers might not be attached correctly, but when I switched to the radio (tuner) function of the stereo, both speakers DO work. So it appears that this TP-link unit does not convert to both channels of a stereo receiver. So, music comes out of just 1 speaker AND it creates static. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Novik

customer_reviews.title: Great for Firestick+Projector with sound BT to a Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Since we watch shows and movies via Amazon FireStick and a projector, we were trying to find a way to use our receiver to play the sound. This product allowed us to connect the sound from our FireStick to come out on our receiver via Bluetooth. You connect it the same way you would connect any other BT device on a FireStick.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Alexa likes it!
customer_reviews.text: I use Amazon Echo (Alexa) to listen to music but the sound quality isn’t that great . I have connected this to my amplifier and get the sound through Bluetooth to my Bose speakers. Works well, Alexa has no problem connecting to it when she is asked. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Bluetooth Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth audio device. Range is good and I think the sound is louder/fuller then when connected to headphone jack. All necessary cables included. I especially like the fact that it uses USB for power which makes it easy to acquire power from your audio device or the included power adapter. If using in a 12V environment (Car, RV, Boat, etc.) I recommend the 12/24V to 5V USB adapter,
customer_reviews.author: theitguy

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth receiver! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: What a great device! We have a Bose L1 amplifier/PA system and needed to go bluetooth because the iphone cable doesn't seat well in the bottom of the iphone. (Bose port was good) It connects to the iPhone easily - is always visible to select. The only thing that would be better is if it didn't need to be plugged in - if it were battery or chargeable. However, it's really small, light and works extremely well. Bose was going to charge $100 for their bluetooth product. I took a chance on TP Link - glad I did. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Catgetsdown

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: This item is a must get!! You know those things that you want to connect to another device and all of those cords included, unsightly ha? But getting this Wireless Streaming Adapter makes all of them cords go away. You can connect your Smart Phone, Tablet, Bose Speaker and or sound bar, which i have my TV connected to and it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last more then 6 months before having connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my car allowing me to have Bluetooth connectivity instead of using the AUX cord all the time, but after some time, this is now starting not to connect each time requiring me to unplug the power and replug it in before it connects. I sometimes can go weeks without issues and other times have days in a row where I have todo this to make it work. I am not currently in the market for a new one that won’t give me this issue. I’ve owned it for over a year now but I expected more time with it before having to trash it
customer_reviews.author: kwest0530

customer_reviews.title: New Best Friend
customer_reviews.text: I had gone over to Micro Center and was about to buy it but decided to look online for a better deal and definitely did! I love how small and barely noticeable the device is, as well as all the convenient connections it comes with. There's a very slight delay with the sound playing (when pushing play, skipping a through a song, or on a virtual instrument; piano, guitar, etc.) but not big enough to affect anything or make me blow my brains out lol I definitely recommend this to whomever is curious at buying the product! Especially if you want to see less wires in your life and wouldn't want you spend so much on wireless speakers alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliabilely pairs every time
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, it is small, out of the way, you would never see it. I connected it to a Bose wave radio. Every night I stream the BBC World service on my phone to the Bose and use the sleep timers on the phone and Bose to shut off after 40 minutes when I am asleep. I also listen to a streaming music programs for a few hours on most Saturdays. The Bluetooth never fails to connect or drop out during streaming. Makes any stereo into a "modern" stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Upgrades Car Bluetooth for Music and Works with Separate Phone Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy pairing with an LG G6. Sounds great, and re-connects perfectly every time. Used in-car, connected to aux input, with a power source that turns off when the car is turned off. No popping or noise, music and navigation sound great. The built-in car Bluetooth for phone calls continues to work seamlessly, with the phone switching to the car Bluetooth when a call is received or started, and back to the music after the call is ended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bundgus

customer_reviews.title: Great for home speaker set up
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a bluetooth receiver for speakers on a desk or for a home theater. Being always on when powered, one can easily connect a phone or laptop to this receiver and play music through any speakers desired through the 3.5mm auxiliary out jack. One thing worth knowing is that it does not automatically connect to my phone when I walk in the room and have bluetooth turned on. I have to go into settings and tap on the receiver in my bluetooth devices list. However this is not a problem for me as I don't want my phone always connected to my desk speakers when I am in the room, but it's still worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Cool and function great to date - Use this to Stream mp3" from my 6 terabyte NAS to my Home Sony Reciver and Bosch Power Box I have Mounted 50' outside on the patio while using laptop or tablet to play albums /cd playlist etc works flawlessly so far and amazed the blue tooth actually works through at least one wall without line of site which is normally the biggest downside to blue tooth
customer_reviews.author: Floyd T. Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth dongle.
customer_reviews.text: What a great little thing this is. My parents gave me an old Bose system that had been sitting in their basement un-used for 15 years. The Bose system was old enough to pre-date digital anything. Plugged this in and was up and listening to music in 5 minutes. I love TP-Link products, they are always very high quality. 20 bucks for a high quality product and was up and running in no time. I should say I was looking for one like this with no built in battery, as it is being used on a stationary sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Degger

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works well in my 2007 TSX with my antiquated head unit. Just needed to plug it in to my power outlet and aux port , sync it to my phone once and it quickly connects without fail every time I get in my car. Seamless! I did buy an inline filter based on a suggestion (Mpow Ground Loop Noise Isolator) and certainly seems to keep sound quality very high.
customer_reviews.author: MITCH T

customer_reviews.title: Great device and top quality
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great receiver. I replaced this with the AmazonBasic model and boy was there a difference in sound quality. I thought the Amazon one was good but it was a few years old and I wanted to try a newer model. I'm glad that I did, and the unit is quite small and compact. I use this in combination with my MacBook Air and Sony stereo receiver. I have it powered on when the receiver is on since there is no off switch on the TP-Link receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Matt from SD

customer_reviews.title: Good enough that I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it can connect to two devices for speedy switching, rather than disconnecting/forgetting one to use another. It's not as magically automatic as you'd think, and expect a few seconds of looking at it wondering if it's going to work (it eventually does). Nice sound quality, good enough range to walk around the house a bit.
customer_reviews.author: johnxtampa

customer_reviews.title: At home I patch into my guitar amp and play along or just listen and then I use my iPad through it watching videos and recordings of myself playing along with my favorite songs. Trust me
customer_reviews.text: This is what you want. I’ve bought the rechargeable and they never last. All you need is a USB plug and it feeds your device all the Bluetooth volume it can stand. Automatically hooks up to my phone at home and in my car. At home I patch into my guitar amp and play along or just listen and then I use my iPad through it watching videos and recordings of myself playing along with my favorite songs. Trust me. I’m a musician. For the bucks, it’s my bang!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McEntire

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working properly terrible customer service. Buy elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy an additional inline noise isolater due to static in my 4runner. This unit worked well for a couple months but now it doesn’t automatically connect when I turn on the truck. I have to unplug usb power and reconnect. I called customer support at tp link and I cannot remember a more frustrating experience. It will take you two hours of phone calls and 5 emails to even begin to replace at $20 item. I gave up and will replace with a quality unit. This company doesn’t stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: T. DeFreitas

customer_reviews.title: The best bluetooth adapter I have used
customer_reviews.text: The best bluetooth adapter I have used. Connects automatically 99% of the time (I have had to reset it once in the several weeks I have had it) and was easy to set up. My car has an RCA connection for the AUX port, so this one came with everything I needed to get up and running.
customer_reviews.author: speed6

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: So far mine works really well on my non bluetooth speakers I've got paired to an amazon fire box. It automatically pairs with no problem and works well with my macbook as well. I've never noticed any lipsync/lag issues when watching movies, although there is some sometimes on the occasion i use Crackle. But Crackle has never performed very well with my setup so i cannot fault the TP-Link for that really. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jmbsol

customer_reviews.title: it worked great; the fidelity was better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in November 2017. After setting up, it worked great; the fidelity was better than expected. That is the good news. The bad is that after about 4 months, all of a sudden the volume level and quality of the sound diminished to the point where it was unusable. After eliminating all other variables, it was clearly a fault with the device. TP Link customer service was very responsive, but in order to obtain a replacement (RMA) the shipping cost was the customer's responsibility! This cost was about the same as the original cost of the unit! Just didn't seem right. Will find an alternate solution.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bluetooth adapter for stereo
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to attach to auxiliary input on my large stereo so I could stream Spotify from my phone, and iPad videos. The sound quality is great & the range is very good all through my home.
customer_reviews.author: toma114

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pipe my echo dot through my computer 5.1 speakers in my office. Works perfectly, just select your echo in the alexa app, go to it's bluetooth settings and pair it as a speaker. It connects automatically. Note, if you play music at a good volume, alexa will not hear you very well but that should be obvious. I keep the dot at volume 10 and control the volume through my computer.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: Pairing was easy with my echo dot
customer_reviews.text: Small and feels very well built. Pairing was easy with my echo dot. Luckily I didn't have to use the power supply that came with it and just use the usb power from my receiver. I was worried about the power requirement worked out well. This is a replacement from my other bluetooth receiver that seems to loose connection more frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Tirso Cruise

customer_reviews.title: Nice pairing with Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great match with an Echo Dot. I am using it to stream via Bluetooth to a receiver in the basement that runs outdoor speakers. It goes through the floor and appx 15 feet flawlessly. BTW, great job by Amazon building the "connect speaker" / "disconnect speaker" commands into Alexa. What a great solution to enable the Dot to be used with the receiver and on its own!
customer_reviews.author: J.T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Annoying beeps.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this device for a hand-me-down stereo receiver from the 70s. Has good range and I like that you can connect multiple devices. Comes with RCA cable as well as 3.5mm. Downsides: Volume change beeps. These are the most subtle of the feedback noises I've had on a bluetooth receiver, but I've always found these really obnoxious. I really don't understand why manufactures don't give a switch for this, tiny mechanical or software. Also I wish there was a passcode or connect button, as the good range does not lend well to neighbors in multi unit buildings. I've changed the name of mine to a something foul to deter connects.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond L

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Exactly what I was looking for. I needed a Bluetooth receiver that **DID NOT** have a battery inside so that the Bluetooth would connect when I started my car and disconnect when I shut the car off. Works great every time. I did need to purchase abecause I was getting a hum, but I think that was because of an issue with the car, and not with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Work great, used only for music
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this for music playing only, then this piece is working more than great. I tried many other brands, nothing is compared to this bluetooth receiver. the sound quality is fine, I couldn't find any difference between it and when playing aux cable. though the size is somehow larger that other brands, wish if it become smaller next versions.
customer_reviews.author: Muhaimen Ezabbad

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this to give myself the ability to connect my phone to my (older) car stereo via Bluetooth. After installing an auxiliary cable in the back of my stereo and plugging this in, it worked--but there was a lot of buzz that modulated with the car engine. I ended up purchasing an $11 ground loop isolator to run between this product and the stereo, and the problem was completely gone. It now sounds excellent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: Never push a Connect Bluetooth button again!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for something like this device forever as I am upgrading from an old push-button device. Love the auto-on auto-connect feature so as soon as I turn on my car my music is ready to go. Only thing I haven't figured out is the volume reduction when going back to music once a call interrupts. This may be particular to Pandora, Pixel 3a XL, or the Bluetooth itself since a disconnect and reconnect from my phone fixes that issue. Overall I love the device plus passenger pairing is genius!!
customer_reviews.author: Irvin Barahona

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should, could be better with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect as a bluetooth device. Wish it worked better with alexa as you have to say "connect to *name of device*" and "disconnect from *name of device*" everytime you want to switch it between your Alexa speaker and whatever your bluetooth is connected to. Would be perfect if you were never disconnecting the 2 devices.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Effective and reliable quality and spot on design
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth receiver Just what I wanted. To connect to my amp.. plus points : 1. no dependence on battery. Its such a relief that i can now enjoy without fear of battery getting flat. 2. So easy to pair.. love the ease with which it pairs to any new device unlike other Bluetooth devices that need to be enabled in pairing mode. 3. Super long range. I can freely move around with mobile from room to room.. and the connection to tp link just stays hooked rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Joel John

customer_reviews.title: Lag & Flakey Bluetooth Connection
customer_reviews.text: I use the receiver to connect a powered speaker to an echo dot. Most of the time I have to prompt alexa a second time to in order to hear a response or get music to kick in. (wired connection or dot alone work perfectly fine). Every couple weeks I need to reset it as it loses the connection to the dot. I'd suggest another receiver.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for vehicles!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little Bluetooth receiver. I recently bought a new car that I was sad to find out didn't have Bluetooth for music, so picked up this little guy have it plugged into the aux port and to a USB port, the USB port in my new car turns on and off with the radio making this a perfect solution
customer_reviews.author: warren

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to interface our Echo to the home audio system. Hook-up was easy & straight-forward and it works perfectly. Also the Echo receiver feature is nice, since our Echo is in the kitch. & the stereo is in the livingroom. It was always hard for it to hear us from there and now it picks up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: "Paco Sanchez"

customer_reviews.title: Works, but often fails to boot
customer_reviews.text: This adapter works great once connected. However, in a car, where you would want to have the device automatically turn on/off and connect, it often fails to boot properly when the car is turned on. This requires you to unplug and replug the adapter, which wears out the fragile micro-USB power port and completely negates the point of having a Bluetooth adapter (not having to fiddle with cables when you enter/exit the car). This boot issue occurs frequently enough and is annoying enough that it drops my would-be-4-star review down to 1.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Giggie

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This item works better in my car than in my apartment, where the sound gets choppy (intermittent interference) at just 20 feet away (direct line of sight). The tiny battery powered bluetooth I initially had in my car works better than this TP Link device in my home. Customer service was very responsive, but quite disappointing ultimately, stating "The 60 feet is tested under a very ideal circumstances on the lab, the range and distance will be affected by the actual environment and the wireless interference on the environment." TL/DR - Actual results may vary. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sam k.

customer_reviews.title: Great range. Good sound. Flawless manual pairing.
customer_reviews.text: The range of operation is excellent in my 500sqft studio. It sounds good. And I prefer manual, rather than, annoying automatic pairing. And manual pairing with my iPhone 11 has been fast and flawless with this bluetooth receiver. A+
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works as I expected, which is a pleasant surprise!
customer_reviews.text: So often these days, devices like this are a bit convoluted, and end up just not working the way you would expect. Not the case here! I have been very pleased with how well this works, and how easy it is to use. I currently use it for playing music from my phone over the receiver/speakers we have, or connecting to Alexa from my Echo, for a variety of purposes. I have since purchased a TP-Link router and a couple of TP-Link wi-fi enabled light bulbs and have been pleased!
customer_reviews.author: John and Judi

customer_reviews.title: great bluetooth range; short power cord
customer_reviews.text: straight out of the box - works well. simple to set up and great range - no cutout through multiple walls with metal and glass doors. the included power cord is short...way short - glad I had a usb extension cable laying around. would defiantly recommend this product if you want to put a pair of powered speakers to work by means of bluetooth, or want to migrate away from a pc setup piped directly into your receiver (which is what I did).
customer_reviews.author: tff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bluetooth Reciever
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few knock-off bluetooth receivers before trying a nicer one. This one is exactly what I should have gotten to start with. It installs very easily, my phone connects very quickly every time my car starts. It is hidden in my center console, but has no issues with sound quality. I added a ground loop noise isolator, and that got rid of the high frequency whine that matched my engine RPM. It saved my hundreds from buying a new receiver since my car has bluetooth phone pairing but not bluetooth audio.
customer_reviews.author: RCR_CT

customer_reviews.title: This is the best
customer_reviews.text: If you have an echo dot or the new echo 2 both with the audio output jack.and want to connect to your audio system by bluetooth this is the unit to use.I have tried 3 other brands and returned all 3 because of connection problems. This unit works great with no problems at all. You will be happy with it..
customer_reviews.author: Larry from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Initial Impression
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to connect to my shop stereo system. An excellent device that is easy to set-up and use thanks to the understandable instructions. I'm using the included AC adapter and all is working quite well. Pairs effortlessly with an Iphone. I like the idea of not having to use batteries. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: rpurdum

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice! Most times it automatically syncs with my phone when I start the car so I can just press play for my music on my phone and go. I gave it 4 stars because there have been quite a few times that it does not sync when I start the car and I've had to unplug and then re-plug it to get it to connect. Once synced, the connection is good and the music quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Just_my_opinion

customer_reviews.title: Beats the crap out of Google Chromecast!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Chromecast audio and I am very happy. The Chromecast was a piece of turd! Always disconnecting and with often choppy playback... Only drawback is now all sounds come through the stereo instead of just the tab I am casting, but that's ok...at least this one works!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rose

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Won't be disappointed with this. Easy setup and works well. Only negative, there is some intermittent interference when you are 25 to 30 feet or more from unit. Does broadcast a signal through walls. Still a must have. Liked it so much I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: It works great but..
customer_reviews.text: I like the small unobtrusive design. My devices connect quickly and the connection remains stable. The only thing I don't like about is that is does not have a it's own power source. It does not have a battery and must be connected to a USB power source to operate. If this had it's own power source and the price was the same, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: A fresh breath of life into my 30 year old Radio Shack/Optimus Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: A superb bluetooth receiver. Comes with everything you need to connect to your older AV receiver to stream from your phone, tablet or other bluetooth-enabled device. Quick pairing, always on when plugged in, great sound. Covers my whole garage so I can keep my phone with me when working in the shop and still stream Amazon Music or SiriusXM from my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: hitech

customer_reviews.title: Easy hook up and pairing.
customer_reviews.text: Works great pairing my desktop computer to my Vintage Pioneer receiver. Now I can stream audio from Spotify, YouTube, media player or any audio source. Breathes new life into my receiver. Paired very easily. Great buy for twenty bucks. Audio sound very good to me btw.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for a couple months now, and i love it. Cheap alternative to other bluetooth devices. Works from almost anywhere in the house (i have an adobe house with thick, dense walls, so sometimes i get skipping when im far away with) my speakers are close to a usb port, so connections are a breeze, and i cant tell any difference in sound quality between bluetooth and direct input.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Van Cleave

customer_reviews.title: Get It!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 2010 Honda. The usb audio capability that came with the car is outdated and unsupported by my iPhone 7+. I ordered the anker 2 port car charger to power this and charge my phone. The audio quality is great, and I use this almost every day while I drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: It works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bluetooth receiver works fantastic, it works great at long distances and performs as advertised. I would not waste your time on other no name brands, TP link has always been reliable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie LaDuke

customer_reviews.title: The bluetooth receiver I've been looking for since 2011.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bluetooth receiver I have ever used and exactly what I wanted for my car. Plug it in and it turns on (always on when plugged in) and silently reconnects to the previous device. Want to connect to another device? Just scan the NFC tag built into the device or the extra NFC tag that comes with it. There is almost no noise produced over the connection and the connection is supurb; while others drop and stutter, I've had no problems with this one at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcelrath

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound. Needs wired power.
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth receiver has the best sound of any I've ever owned. The only negative is that does NOT have a battery - it has to be plugged in for power. I almost returned it for this reason but decided to run a power line when I heard it's sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: AMColorado

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: My dad absolutely loved this. Bought it as a present for him and he was literally the happiest man alive. He has an ancient stereo system he refuses to get rid of and he’s a bit on the older technologically challenged side but he was able to figure it out right away.
customer_reviews.author: Natty

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: works nice but I am not getting the distance it stated. It seems to have the same range as the other style I purchased about 1 year ago. It connects well and I wanted it for better connects and multiple cell phones. I would likely purchase again. Size is nice and small. Came with a power cord was a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: mi-matt

customer_reviews.title: Has been working flawlessly since day one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my vehicle which happens to have a standard outlet and an aux input in the center console. I connected my iPhone after plugging it in and the sound quality is great. My phone always connects when I turn on my car and stays connected until I turn the car off. No more plugging in an aux cable for me!
customer_reviews.author: DSM

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful purchase! The instructions for installation are very poor. But once you figure it out, it’s a great asset. I can easily listen to all the music I’ve downloaded to my iPad, phone, and to Google Play on my stereo speakers with the click of a single key.
customer_reviews.author: LBL

customer_reviews.title: Best for car Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect Bluetooth for my car because it has no battery and powers on only when it has a power supply. It takes only a few seconds to connect my phone, from a cold start after I start my engine. I had another Bluetooth, but it has a battery and requires me to hold the button for unreliable three to five seconds to turn it on. That's a real pain. So, never consider models with a battery for car use. Dedicate it to your car, then you will have a much smoother experience.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: I definitely wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t maintain the WiFi signal. The range is approximately 10 to 15 feet, and NOT 60 FEET AS ADVERTISED. TP-LINK SHOULD REWRITE THEIR PRODUCT DESCRIPTION. IT’S JUST CHINA JUNK......
customer_reviews.author: jlo

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This device bridged the technology gap between my 25 year old stereo system, and my android phone & tablet. It's great to be able to stream music from the internet, to the old yet still works great stereo... plus, control wireless from around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Joe Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for old receivers
customer_reviews.text: Have alexa echo and try adding alexa to existing denon receiver. Since receiver is more than 10years old, it lacks network functionality. With this one and put adaptor to switched receiver’s power, work very well. You can enjoy with Echo’s speaker and if you want to play through receiver, then just turn receiver on. It will connect to receiver.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: It works. Don’t ask. If it’s what you need, get it.
customer_reviews.text: It works. What can I say? I personally prefer Bluetooth unit that auto connects. Because of how it operates, it automatically connects to my phone. Immediately. I mean, within 5 seconds. The downside is that it can’t operate without power supply. I use it for my old car. It works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Chung

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 and they both work great. No digital stuttering like with a different bluetooth ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and they both work great. No digital stuttering like with a different bluetooth device I use. No annoying tone when it connects. Automatic connection: make sure your phone bluetooth is turned on FIRST, then turn on this device, and it will connect automatically (after the initial set-up procedure and pairing). This is what I do in my van. If you leave this device permanantly plugged in so it is always on, then it will not connect automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the car.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Plugged it into my car. Hooks up to my phone as soon as I start the car. Turns off when the car turns off. Way way way better than the ones with a battery. No buttons on the unit at all. Just plug in and link up.
customer_reviews.author: J.Hester

customer_reviews.title: Constant Beeping Noise
customer_reviews.text: Great Device and pairs very quickly but what I don't understand is why is there a constant beeping noise when volume is fully turned up on my phone (iPhone X). Even with the changing of music "beep" then any announcement from the GPS "beep" it only stops if I turn the volume down by -2 bars when max volume. Other then that it works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dee. R

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Bought to play my iPhone through my amplifier. A function of the phone would beep every time the volume was adjusted or a song skipped, which was highly annoying. Wished this worked like my bluetooth player, which didn’t replicate the beeping.
customer_reviews.author: V. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Wide Range, smart connect, works with many devices
customer_reviews.text: works well; it really works at 20 feet from the receiver. One little problem is you can’t play voice record from your iphone. I have iphone 6s plus; voice record can’t play; checked with other iphones too. Iphones Voice record can’t be played Iphone Music and other stuff like game play, they are working but not voice record.
customer_reviews.author: DKING

customer_reviews.title: Worked well. Died after 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: My unit just died, after ~17 months so out of warranty. It was permanently plugged into one of my cars and got ~5 hours of usage per week. This was one of the more pricier BT receivers so I expected it to last longer than it did. Aside from that, sound quality was good and the NFC tags make it simple to pair with new devices. This model is perfect for a car because it doesn't have a battery, so it turns on/off when the car does.
customer_reviews.author: otm shank

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying to use, but works ok
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into an accessory powered socket, when the car starts the unit does not power up, needs to be unplugged and replugged from power to boot, which basically means you have to manually connect to it every time you want to use it opposed to an automatic connection when the car starts. The Bluetooth connection is unstable, sound gets choppy randomly.
customer_reviews.author: Marinos P. Kakouris

product_meta.title: TP-Link NFC-Enabled Bluetooth 4.1 Receiver, Wireless Audio Adapter Streaming Music from Echo Smart Phone Tablet PC to Home Car Stereo Sound System (HA100)
product_meta.description: The HA100 provides your stereo with Bluetooth connectivity, enabling you to stream music wirelessly from your smartphone or tablet. You can just sit back and relax as you listen to and control your favorite playlists away from your stereo.
feature_bullets: Universal Compatibility: enable your high quality speakers or home/car stereo sound system Bluetooth compatibility, to stream audio from your smartphone/tablet/PC/echo or any Bluetooth enabled devices
2x Wireless Range: extend the Bluetooth wireless range up to 20 meters (66 feet), stream your music stably from 2 times further away than other models do

High Quality Wireless Music Performance: built in amplifier chip and CSR chip that supports Bluetooth 4.1 and A2DP v1.2, provide high performance wireless music experience from your favourite streaming platforms, Spotify, Apple Music, pandora, and etc
5 Star Driver's Choice: Auto-On/Off with Your Car, get ready for playing music in seconds; NFC Tag for Passenger Pairing, make it much easier for passenger to connect and play their own music
Multipoint Technology: stay connected with 2 of your frequently used devices, seamlessly switching audio source

NFC Quick Pairing & Easy Setup: one click to pair up with your NFC enabled devices as soon as getting close to the HA100 or NFC tag. Connect to stereo system supporting 3.5 millimeter AUX or RCA jacks

Package Contents: Bluetooth Music Receiver HA100, USB Charging Cable, 3.5 millimeter to RCA Cable, 3.5 millimeter to 3.5 millimeter Cable, Power Adapter, NFC Tag, User Guide, 12-month warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support

Improve Echo That Has Trouble Hearing You: echo usually has trouble hearing you because of the overwhelming music as it has to be fixed next to the TV or stereo system. HA100 serves as Bluetooth wireless bridge that enables echo anywhere convenient for you

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,298 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
